author: parithosh
content: I would really prefer not to. Its gonna be a bikeshed rabbithole as to why eof-devnet-0 isn't fulu-devnet-0. I would like to avoid it and leave that problem for ACD to decide post Pectra, esp if it doesn't gain us anything.

author: _shemnon
content: My take is that eof-devnet-0 isn't in fulu-devnet-0 because fulu is CL only.  osaka-devent-0 wold have the EOF changes (and no peerdas changes).  The fusaka-devnet-0 would be a combined EL/CL devnet.

author: _shemnon
content: I also want to call the first EOF devnet osaka-devnet-0

author: parithosh
content:
Is there any reason to not just call them by their feature names though(`eof-devnet-0` and `peerdas-devnet-4..`)? And once they are merged into the "official" fork, then we have `fusaka-devnet-0` incorporating all EIPs?

We did this premature renaming once in the past with verkle, we had it labelled as `electra` and that seeped its way into types and dependent libs. Now that it isn't electra and we had to rename/rebase a bunch of things, it just led to a lot of renaming/rebasing we could have avoided and wasted dev cycles. This is not a comment on `eof/peerdas` not being in `fusaka`, but merely about premature naming ending up hurting us for no real benefit.

The main counter argument I see is that we're already activating EOF on `osakaTimestamp` and peerDAS on `FULU_FORK_EPOCH`, so we're kind of already pre-commited.

author: _shemnon
content: EIP-7607 has PeerDAS and EOF in the "Scheduled for Inclusion" category, which says that it is for "When client teams agree to implement an EIP in the next Upgrade Devnet".  I'm sure this will be a discussion in ACD, as bikeshedding the schedule will certianly be a topic this week or next

author: _shemnon
content: The monkey wrench is EIP-7723 is that SFI may only be directed at combo EL+CL devnets, and we are not ready for a Fusaka-0 devnet by any measure.
